instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 External display but no video out on built in LCD
threads.message:
Liquid damage on LCD connector but only where it connects to the screen not on the logic board. Tried a replacement screen and also replaced the cable as it was seriously burnt / corroded but no luck.
Only one of the USB C ports works at the moment the other one just keeps blinking the AMP/Volt meter.
I get output to an external screen but no video on the built in LCD ( I think there is backlight but no video)

What should I measure as I am at a loss.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 External display but no video out on built in LCD
threads.message:
Liquid spill on the other LCD connector is equally dangerous.
Check diode mode to ground on EDP_INT_ lines...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 External display but no video out on built in LCD
threads.message: Do I do this with a screen attached?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 External display but no video out on built in LCD
threads.message:
I suppose to have a problem on the MLB.
No need to connect the LCD; we chase the onboard fault.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 External display but no video out on built in LCD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 External display but no video out on built in LCD
threads.message:
I'm not sure what you did there.
I said to check diode mode to ground.

Read "How To collection" thread, if you need help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 External display but no video out on built in LCD
threads.message: Hi, I did do diode mode to ground. Red probe on ground and black probe on test points. What did I do wrong? Also checked these test points on another working board and got the same results.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 External display but no video out on built in LCD
threads.message:
0 means zero, SHORT to ground.
If you mean OL, tell us.

OL is what you get, for sure; just saw the series caps now.
You should get something around 0.400-0.700 in diode mode, on the left side of the caps <CAPACITOR>C8520</CAPACITOR>-29.
